meanings.definition: In a playful or mischievous manner
meanings.sent1: She skipped anticly around the playground, giggling with joy.
meanings.sent2: The children were running anticly in the park, enjoying the sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail anticly as it chased its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The leaves danced anticly in the wind, creating a whimsical scene.
meanings.sent5: The clown juggled anticly, entertaining the audience with his tricks.

meanings.definition: Characterized by playful or silly behavior
meanings.sent1: The kitten's anticly behavior amused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The movie had an anticly plot that kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent3: The anticly squirrel stole a nut from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her anticly personality always brought a smile to people's faces.
meanings.sent5: The anticly group of friends always found ways to have fun together.

meanings.definition: A playful or silly act or gesture
meanings.sent1: His anticly made everyone burst into laughter at the party.
meanings.sent2: The children's anticly was contagious, spreading joy to all.
meanings.sent3: The anticly of the monkey at the zoo delighted the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her anticly of wearing mismatched socks was her signature style.
meanings.sent5: The anticly of the clown brought smiles to the faces of the audience.
